programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: NBA Courtside
programme.desc: An insight into upcoming National Basketball Association matches, highlighting the players to watch and the top team news.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Timberwolves begin their season series with the Cavaliers in the second leg of a six-game road trip. In Minnesota's last trip to Cleveland, the Wolves escaped with a 129-124 triumph despite a career-high 51-point outburst from Darius Garland.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Giannis Antetokounmpo and the Bucks visit Los Angeles for the first of two games, as they start with LeBron James' Lakers. Since James joined the Lakers in 2018, Milwaukee is 7-3 against Los Angeles, with Antetokounmpo averaging 33.4 points per game.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: "College GameDay" gets fans ready for all the day's action in men's college basketball with exclusive interviews, analysis, behind-the-scenes features and predictions. The primary host is Rece Davis, joined by analysts Jay Bilas, Seth Greenberg and LaPhonso Ellis. The show typically originates from the site of one of the day's biggest games.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 16 Crimson Tide vie for a double-bye in the SEC Tournament as they host the Razorbacks. Alabama is in a five-team scrum to finish the regular season in the top four behind Tennessee. Mark Sears paces the Crimson Tide at 21.1 points per game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Longhorns (19-11, 8-9) and the Sooners (20-10, 8-9) jockey for positioning prior to the Big 12 Tournament. The schools could be headed for a second-round meeting to begin their brackets in Kansas City. Texas has won six in a row over Oklahoma.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 1 Cougars try to exact revenge from Hunter Dickinson and the No. 14 Jayhawks in a Big 12 showdown. Kansas won the first meeting 78-65 on Feb. 3. Dickinson, a 7-foot-2 senior, recorded 20 points in that game. Houston is 16-0 at home.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: "College GameDay" gets fans ready for all the day's action in men's college basketball with exclusive interviews, analysis, behind-the-scenes features and predictions. The primary host is Rece Davis, joined by analysts Jay Bilas, Seth Greenberg and LaPhonso Ellis. The show typically originates from the site of one of the day's biggest games.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Longtime Tobacco Road rivals duel when No. 7 North Carolina visits No. 9 Duke. The Tar Heels clinched a share of a record 33rd regular-season crown March 5, but the Blue Devils can put a hand on the ACC title by tying UNC at 16-4 in conference play.

programme.title: UFC 299: O'Malley vs. Vera 2 - Prelims
programme.desc: Pedro Munhoz vs. Kyler Phillips, bantamweight; Mateusz Gamrot vs. Rafael Dos Anjos, lightweight; Katlyn Cerminara vs. Maycee Barber, flyweight; Curtis Blaydes vs. Jailton Almeida, heavyweight. From Kaseya Center in Miami.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 5 Wildcats, hoping to play deep into Spring, finish the regular season by visiting the Trojans. On Jan. 17, Arizona collected a sixth straight win over USC with a commanding 82-67 verdict. Arizona senior Caleb Love scored 20 in that contest.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Celtics and Suns tip off in the first of two meetings in six days. The two contenders have split the past five season series. Boston All-Stars Jayson Tatum and Jaylen Brown both reached 25 points in a victorious trip to Phoenix in 2022-23.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: Host Elle Duncan and analysts Andraya Carter, Rebecca Lobo, Carolyn Peck, Holly Rowe and Chiney Ogwumike cover all the angles in women's college basketball with previews, exclusive interviews, analysis, behind-the-scenes features and predictions.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: From Greensboro Coliseum in Greensboro, N.C.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: From Bon Secours Wellness Arena in Greenville, S.C.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Championship.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: East rivals in the 76ers and Knicks start a two-game series at Madison Square Garden. New York won the first two meetings this season, both in Philadelphia, by a combined 50 points. Knicks guard Jalen Brunson totaled 50 points in those contests.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Timberwolves aim to claim the season series against the Lakers in this match. Minnesota took a pair of contests in Los Angeles' prior stomping grounds in December 2023. Wolves star Anthony Edwards averaged 29 points per game in those wins.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: Presenting the latest news from the world of sports.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: From Harrah's Cherokee Center in Asheville, N.C.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 25 Flyers (23-6, 13-4 A-10) tune up for the postseason by playing the Rams (19-11, 11-6). Dayton comes off a 100-83 win at Saint Louis on March 5, but VCU held the Flyers to their lowest point total of the season in a 49-47 Rams victory.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Green Wave (13-16, 4-13 American) try to end their slide when they play the Shockers (13-17, 5-12). Tulane's 85-72 loss to South Florida was its seventh in a row. Wichita State aims to play its way out of the conference tournament's first round.

programme.title: Jimmy Houston Outdoors
programme.desc: Jimmy is bonefishing in the Bahamas off of Andros Island.

programme.title: Scott Martin Challenge
programme.desc: Scott vs. Bassmaster Elite Pro John Cox on Jurassic Park in Florida.

programme.title: AKC K9 Detection Dogs
programme.desc: The best narcotics and explosives detection dogs from around the nation come together to demonstrate the important role dogs play in law enforcement and keeping the country safe.

programme.title: Coach K & Roy Williams: Rivals Reunited
programme.desc: Two of the most successful NCAA basketball coaches in history, Mike Krzyzewski and Roy Williams, meet for a rare in-depth conversation, something they never did together during their coaching careers at Duke and North Carolina.

programme.title: Bad Beats
programme.desc: A look at the moments that drove sports bettors wild during recent games.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: Max Verstappen rolls into the Saudi Arabian Grand Prix. Verstappen, the three-time defending world champion who won a record 19 races last year, started 2024 in style with a victory in Bahrain. His teammate, Sergio Pérez, won in Saudi Arabia in 2023.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 6 Cyclones (24-6, 13-4) warm up for the Big 12 Tournament by visiting the Wildcats (17-13, 7-10). Iowa State could still unseat No. 1 Houston for the top seed in the tournament by winning this contest and getting favorable results on the day.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Hurricanes (15-14, 6-13 ACC) stumble into this regular-season finale against the Seminoles (15-15, 9-10). Miami tries to go into the ACC Tournament on a winning note after dropping eight in a row. Florida State has won 11 of the last 12 meetings.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 11 Bears (22-8, 11-6 Big 12) and Red Raiders (21-9, 10-7) both aim to maintain momentum entering the conference tournament. Texas Tech has won two in a row, but Baylor has three straight wins and defeated the Red Raiders 79-73 on Feb. 6.

programme.desc: Championship.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: Sidney Crosby and the Penguins visit the Bruins for a black-and-gold adorned matinee. Crosby scored the go-ahead goal and provided two assists in Pittsburgh's 6-5 victory at Boston on Jan. 4. The Penguins are mired in a three-game road slide.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Oscar nominee Steve James returns to his hometown of Hampton, Virginia, to take a personal look at a still disputed incident in the life of a young Allen Iverson.

programme.desc: Boise State faces No. 21 San Diego State in a regular-season finale. The Broncos gained the edge in the season series with a nail-biting 67-66 triumph Jan. 20. O'Mar Stanley (BOIS) was perfect from 3-point land in that win, finishing with 17 points.

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure
programme.desc: Time to make the money in the Bahamas. The top 127 in the PCA Main Event will get a slice of the $8.6m prize pool. At the feature table, British pro Sam Grafton plays against his hero, poker legend Jason Mercier.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Blue Demons get one last chance at a Big East regular-season victory when they visit the Pirates in New Jersey. DePaul sits at 3-27 this campaign, 0-19 in-conference, and is winless in 2024. Seton Hall silenced DePaul 72-39 in Chicago on Jan. 30.

programme.title: FS1 College Hoops Extra
programme.desc: Highlights and analysis of today's college basketball action.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Bruins and the Sun Devils play the final Pac-12 contest of the 2023-24 regular season. UCLA has won seven of its last eight matchups against Arizona State after a 68-66 decision on Jan. 17. Serbian guard Lazar Stefanovic led UCLA with 18 points.

programme.desc: The No. 2 Huskies tune up for the Big East Tournament and beyond by visiting the Friars. Defending national champion UConn beat Providence for the third straight time, 74-65 in January behind point guard Tristen Newton's 16 points and 11 rebounds.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 12 Fighting Illini (22-8, 13-6 Big Ten) complete their regular season by visiting the Hawkeyes (18-12, 10-9). Illinois got a 30-point outburst from Coleman Hawkins, a career high for the senior forward, in a 95-85 win over Iowa on Feb. 24.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Badgers (19-11, 11-8) seek revenge on the No. 3 Boilermakers (27-3, 16-3) in a Big Ten finale. Purdue dumped then-No. 6 Wisconsin 75-69 on Feb. 4. The Boilermakers, locked into the conference's top seed, look to polish off a perfect home record.

programme.title: I Am Kevin Harvick

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Kyle Larson comes in hot as the NASCAR Cup Series heads to Phoenix for the Shriners Children's 500. Larson held off Tyler Reddick to win last week's Pennzoil 400 in Las Vegas. William Byron, who won the 2023 races in Las Vegas and Phoenix, was 10th.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 2 Bluejays play the No. 7 Pirates, for a second straight time, in the Big East Tournament quarterfinals. Creighton won at Seton Hall 72-65 on March 3 for its fifth straight series victory. Seton Hall outlasted DePaul 71-64 in the first round.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 3 Red Storm run into the No. 6 Hoyas in the Big East Tournament quarterfinals. Georgetown has won four in a row, a streak that started with a 51-43 victory over St. John's. Red Storm 5-foot-7 senior Unique Drake averages 18 points per game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 8 Golden Eagles look to rebound ahead of the Big East Tournament versus the Musketeers. Marquette's three-game win streak versus Xavier includes an 88-64 decision Feb. 25 and last season's Big East final. The Eagles have dropped two in a row.
